bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Exhibit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: I, C. D. Bowles, first being duly sworn according to law, depose and says as follows: I accuse M.L. Coovert, of Vancouver, Clarke County, State of Washington, of the crime of selling and furnishing cigarettes, contrary to the statute in such cases made and provided, committed as follows: Said M. L. Coovert is a retail tobacco dealer doing business in Vancouver, County of Clarke, State of Washington, and on Friday, June the 9th, 1893, at his said place of business in said city of Vancouver, the said M. L. Coovert did sell and furnish to one C. L. McDonald one package of cigarettes, more particularly described as follows:

A pasteboard box with loose lifting case cover, not sealed in anyway, and having on said for the name of the manufactuer and brand of cigarettes, but no stamp caution notice of number of manufacuring district or state, and said boy containing fifty bundles of "Peh" paper wrapped cigarettes, ten cigarettes in each bundle and each bundle being wrapped in tinfoil with one outer paper wrapper bering the name of the brand of cigarettes, the statutory caution notice, number of manufacturing District and state, and having pasted around in the required U. S. Revenue Stamp duly cancelled.
which said package of cigarettes was and is of the value of five Dollars Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of June, 1893. C. D. Bowles
